lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Flips the dialog box such that the ImageView is on the left and text on the right.
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {
public static DialogBox getDukeDialog(String text, Image img) {
* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
String result = "Hello from! I'm a Cookie Monster\n" + "What can I do for you?\n";
* @param s string to be thrown during exception.
*  An exception that throws when there is a missing date and time.
* @param s string to be thrown during exception.
* @return a warning message when there is missing information.
return "☹ NOM NOM NOM!! Where is your date/time??";
*  An exception that throws when TaskList is empty.
* @param s string to be thrown during exception.
* @return a warning message when there is missing information.
return "☹ hmm strange the list is missing and so are my cookies?!?";
*  An exception that throws a wrong command is given.
* @param s string to be thrown during exception.
* @return a warning message when there is missing information.
return "☹ HEY stop talking rubbish!! I could be eating cookies instead";
* Class that understands and handles commands
* @param input the full command from the user.
* @param input_arr the full command split in words.
* @param tasks keeps track of the list of tasks
* @param storage stores the list of tasks
* @return a string upon understanding the command.
* @throws Missing if there is missing information regarding date and time
* @throws WrongKeyWord if there is a missing key command
public static String understandInput(String input, String[] input_arr, TaskList tasks, Storage storage) throws Missing, WrongKeyWord {
/** reply to be passed to Ui */
* A class that writes and read Tasks.
* @param filePath path of where the file is.
* Returns an ArrayList of Tasks from the hard-drive.
* @throws TaskListEmpty when the TaskList is empty.
* Writes to the storage file whenever a Task is created.
* @param input string containing the information of the task.
* @param type string containing the type of the task.
public void writeToFile(String input , String type) {
* Returns the current status of the Deadline.
* @return a string with the current status.
* Returns an update upon removal of a Deadline.
* @return a string upon removal of a Deadline.
* @return string regarding addition of a Deadline.
return "Got it. I've added this task:\n " + this.status() + "\n" + "Now you have " + super.total + " tasks in the list";
* Returns the current status of the Event.
* @return a string with the current status.
* @return a string upon removal of an Event.
return "Noted I've removed this task:\n " + this.status()
+ "\n" + "Now you have " + super.total + " tasks in the list";
* @return string regarding addition of an Event.
return "Got it. I've added this task:\n " + this.status() + "\n" + "Now you have " + super.total + " tasks in the list";
/** Number of tasks in the list currently. **/
* @param isDone indicates whether the task is done
* Returns the status and name of the Task.
* @return a string to state the Task as done.
return ("NOM NOM NOM! I've marked this task as done:\n" + this.toString());
* Returns the status and name of the uncompleted Task.
* @return a string to state Task is not done.
return ("NOM NOM NOM! I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + this.toString());
* Returns the status and name of the Task.
* @return a string regarding the status of the Task
* Returns a string after a removal of a task
* @return a string after removal of a task
* A class containing the Tasks current in the checklist.
* Constructor of TaskList with no tasks.
* Returns a Task after deleting it from the index.
* @param index index of the Task to delete from.
* Returns a Task at a given index.
* @param index index of the Task to retrieve.
* Adds a Task to the ArrayList.
* Returns the current Tasks in the checklist.
* @return a string displaying all the Tasks in the checklist.
* @return a string to look for amongst the tasks
* @return string regarding removal of a ToDo
* @return string regarding addition of a ToDo
return "Got it. I've added this task:\n " + this.status() + "\n" + "Now you have " + super.total + " tasks in the list";
